results.description: Core: recent uplift in earnings-related news sentiment predicts short-term returns. Applied SUGGESTION1 by using rp_css_earnings (high user/alpha counts) and SUGGESTION3: coverage=0.5 so ts_backfill used. SUGGESTION2 not applicable (no vector). SUGGESTION4: chose rp_css_earnings due to high userCount/alphaCount. KEEP_IN_MINDs: implementation kept short, <=7 operators, <=2 datafields. Confidence: 0.78

results.idea: Earnings impact vs event sentiment divergence
results.description: Core: difference between impact projection and event sentiment signals upcoming price moves. Used two fields per SUGGESTION1: rp_nip_earnings and rp_ess_earnings. Applied ts_backfill to both (SUGGESTION3). Chose these due to high alphaCount (SUGGESTION4). Kept implementation concise per KEEP_IN_MINDs. Confidence: 0.74

Core: change-in-analyst-reco (nws18_ghc_lna) momentum predicts moves. SUGGESTION1 single but powerful field; SUGGESTION3 used ts_backfill. SUGGESTION4 supported: nws18_ghc_lna high user/alpha counts. No vector. Implementation short. Confidence: 0.70

Core: extreme short-term rp_css_price signals revert. Used SUGGESTION1 single datafield rp_css_price; SUGGESTION3 applied ts_backfill. SUGGESTION4: rp_css_price has good user/alpha. Implemented cross-sectional zscore to capture extremes. Confidence: 0.66
Core: rising investor-relations sentiment (rp_css_inverstor) indicates sustained flows. Applied SUGGESTION3 ts_backfill and SUGGESTION4 (high counts). KEEP_IN_MINDs respected. Confidence: 0.72

Core: divergence between business sentiment and revenue sentiment signals surprise. Used rp_css_business and rp_css_revenue (SUGGESTION1). Both ts_backfill per SUGGESTION3. Selected due to high userCount (rp_css_business). Implementation short. Confidence: 0.71

Core: spikes in mna event sentiment anticipate re-rating. Used rp_ess_mna (event sentiment) and rp_nip_mna (impact projection) per SUGGESTION1. Both backfilled (SUGGESTION3). KEEP_IN_MINDs kept. Confidence: 0.65

Core: sudden changes in price-target news sentiment predict drift. Used rp_css_ptg and rp_nip_ptg (SUGGESTION1). ts_backfill applied to both per SUGGESTION3. Chosen fields have moderate counts. Implementation concise. Confidence: 0.60

Core: strong editorial sentiment (nws18_qmb) correlates with sector moves; pair with rp_css_business for company-specific effect. Applied SUGGESTION1 two fields; ts_backfill both (SUGGESTION3). Used high-count rp_css_business. Implementation short. Confidence: 0.58
Core: event sentiment about insider activity (rp_ess_insider) predicts abnormal returns. SUGGESTION3 used ts_backfill; SUGGESTION4 moderate counts. No vector. Implementation minimal. Confidence: 0.63
Core: spikes in legal news sentiment (rp_ess_legal) imply downside risk; use negative exposure. Used ts_backfill (SUGGESTION3) and cross-sectional zscore. Confidence: 0.55
Core: rapid improvement in revenue sentiment (rp_css_revenue) indicates upside. SUGGESTION3 applied ts_backfill; SUGGESTION4 chosen rp_css_revenue for counts. Implementation concise. Confidence: 0.69

Core: analyst ratings news (rp_css_ratings) vs change-in-analyst-reco (nws18_ghc_lna) divergence predicts moves. Used two fields (SUGGESTION1) and ts_backfill (SUGGESTION3). KEEP_IN_MIND respected. Confidence: 0.73
Core: combine technical-based news sentiment (rp_css_technical) with price sentiment (rp_css_price) to capture crowd sentiment. Both ts_backfill per SUGGESTION3. Limited operators. Confidence: 0.59
Core: product-related positive news (rp_css_product) presages revenue growth expectation. Used ts_backfill (SUGGESTION3) and cs zscore. Confidence: 0.62
Core: partnership event sentiment (rp_ess_partner) signals re-rating when accompanied by high impact (rp_nip_partner). SUGGESTION1 used two fields; ts_backfill both. Confidence: 0.61
Core: dividend-related sentiment (rp_ess_dividends) extremes mean revert. Used ts_backfill and reverse zscore. SUGGESTION4 limited counts considered. Confidence: 0.52
Core: negative credit-related event sentiment (rp_ess_credit) predicts downside. Used ts_backfill (SUGGESTION3) and reverse zscore. Confidence: 0.56
Core: global market editorials (nws18_qmb) combined with composite market sentiment (rp_css_assets) to capture macro-driven alpha. Both ts_backfill per SUGGESTION3. Confidence: 0.57
Core: high magnitude rp_css_price combined with its short-term std dev to get risk-adjusted news. Used two fields (same field with ts_std_dev) — counts OK. ts_backfill applied. Confidence: 0.68
Core: weight event sentiment by nws18_event_relevance to favor important stories. Two fields used per SUGGESTION1; both backfilled per SUGGESTION3. High counts for relevance. Confidence: 0.66

Core: if event similar to past (nws18_event_similarity_days low), effect smaller — scale signal by similarity. Used ts_backfill on both fields. Considered SUGGESTIONS and KEEP_IN_MINDs. Confidence: 0.54
Core: use nws18_qcm (high-confidence news sentiment) to build a low-noise alpha. Applied ts_backfill (SUGGESTION3) and ts_zscore. SUGGESTION4 moderate counts. Confidence: 0.67

Core: combine rp_css_ratings and rp_nip_ratings to reflect both sentiment and projected impact. Both backfilled (SUGGESTION3). High counts for rp_nip_ratings. KEEP_IN_MIND maintained. Confidence: 0.75
Core: companies with revenue sentiment > earnings sentiment may see earnings upgrades; used rp_css_revenue and rp_css_earnings (SUGGESTION1). ts_backfill both. Confidence: 0.70
Core: measure persistence by ts_decay_linear on rp_ess_earnings; persistent positive events likely stronger. Used ts_backfill then ts_decay_linear; SUGGESTION3 applied. Confidence: 0.64
Core: rising rp_nip_inverstor indicates investor-impacting news; backfilled and zscored. SUGGESTION4 chosen for high user/alpha counts. Confidence: 0.73
Core: difference between rp_css_business (company) and rp_css_assets (market) to capture idiosyncratic moves. Both backfilled. Confidence: 0.60
Core: current rp_css_price is the max in last period -> breakout; use ts_arg_max. ts_backfill applied (SUGGESTION3). Confidence: 0.58
Core: extreme rp_ess_price moves often revert next week; implement reverse zscore of recent mean. ts_backfill used. Confidence: 0.55
Core: combine nws18_qcm with rp_css_ratings to isolate high-certainty rating improvements. Both backfilled. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.72
Core: negative rp_ess_labor signals increase risk; scale earnings sentiment by labor sentiment. Two fields used; both backfilled. Confidence: 0.50
Core: positive rp_css_marketing spikes predict short-run demand; backfilled & zscored. Counts moderate. Confidence: 0.57
Core: use rp_css_technical but winsorize extremes to reduce outliers. Applied winsorize + ts_backfill (SUGGESTION3). Confidence: 0.61
Core: society-related news (rp_ess_society) extremes often overreact and revert. ts_backfill + reverse zscore used. Confidence: 0.48
Core: rp_css_price * rp_nip_price to keep only high-impact price-news signals. Two fields, both backfilled per SUGGESTION3. Confidence: 0.65
Core: when earnings event sentiment is recent and high (ts_arg_max small), trade to capture drift. Used ts_arg_max + ts_backfill. KEEP_IN_MINDs maintained. Confidence: 0.62
Core: use ts_ir on rp_nip_inverstor to get information ratio of impact projection; backfilled. SUGGESTION4 leveraged. Confidence: 0.70
Core: average of partner event sentiment and projected impact gives robust signal. Used add + divide (mean) with ts_backfill. Confidence: 0.60
Core: rp_ess_mna / (1 + days since similar event) to reduce stale signals. Used nws18_event_similarity_days for staleness. ts_backfill applied to both. Confidence: 0.59
Core: prefer earnings sentiment signals when rp_ess_earnings has low ts_std_dev (stable). Two operations, both backfilled. Confidence: 0.66
Core: rising rp_nip_credit predicts credit-driven repricing. ts_backfill + ts_zscore used. Confidence: 0.54
Core: combine rp_css_insider with rp_nip_insider to capture both sentiment and projected impact. Both backfilled; SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.63
Core: momentum in rp_nip_ratings (impact projection) predicts follow-through. ts_backfill and ts_returns used to capture momentum. Confidence: 0.71
Core: weight rp_ess_earnings by nws18_qcm (confidence) to reduce noise. Two fields used; both backfilled. Confidence: 0.68
Core: rp_nip_dividends spikes predict short-term moves; backfilled and zscored. Low counts so confidence moderate. Confidence: 0.49
Core: combine rp_css_legal (composite) and rp_nip_legal (impact) to isolate actionable legal stories. Both backfilled. Confidence: 0.60
Core: rp_css_product recent max (ts_arg_max) indicates fresh product news; ts_backfill applied. Confidence: 0.58
Core: information ratio of rp_nip_revenue via ts_ir to find consistent revenue-impact names. ts_backfill used. Confidence: 0.67
Core: combine rp_css_earnings and rp_ess_earnings to ensure both composite and event sentiment align. Both backfilled. Confidence: 0.72
Core: positive marketing sentiment with flat/negative price sentiment signals upcoming re-rate. Used rp_css_marketing and rp_css_price with ts_backfill. Confidence: 0.56
Core: apply ts_decay_linear to rp_nip_ratings to favor recent impactful rating news. ts_backfill applied. Confidence: 0.68
Core: combine rp_css_ptg and rp_css_ratings to identify consensus upgrade stories. Both backfilled. Confidence: 0.66
Core: rp_nip_inverstor divided by its ts_std_dev to get risk-adjusted impact. ts_backfill applied. Confidence: 0.74
Core: aggregate nws18_qmb with rp_css_business to capture editorial lift for a company relative to business sentiment. Both backfilled. Confidence: 0.60
Core: difference between immediate event sentiment and its decayed average to find surprise magnitude. Uses ts_decay_linear and ts_backfill on rp_ess_earnings. Confidence: 0.65
Core: ts_corr between rp_css_price and rp_css_earnings to find names where price moves align with earnings news. Both backfilled. Confidence: 0.63
Core: only trade rp_ess_mna when nws18_qcm exceeds threshold (high-confidence). Used trade_when + ts_backfill. SUGGESTION3 applied. Confidence: 0.62
Core: ts_product (cumproduct) of rp_ess_revenue over short window to detect sustained positive flow. ts_backfill used. Confidence: 0.55
Core: cross-sectional zscore of rp_css_earnings to pick top relative names. Applied zscore and ts_backfill. Confidence: 0.71
Core: ts_ir on rp_nip_partner to find partner news with consistent impact. Backfilled. Confidence: 0.61
Core: only use rp_css_technical when nws18_qcm (confidence) is high; two fields backfilled. Trade_when used. Confidence: 0.59
Core: nws18_ghc_lna combined with rp_css_ratings to capture both change and composite rating tone. Both backfilled. Confidence: 0.74
Core: weight rp_ess_earnings by 1/(1+ts_arg_min) to favor very recent events. ts_backfill used. Confidence: 0.63
Core: rp_css_ptg momentum winsorized to limit outliers; ts_backfill applied. Confidence: 0.62
Core: confirm rp_css_credit move with rp_nip_credit; both backfilled and added. Confidence: 0.58
Core: use days since similar event (nws18_event_similarity_days) to penalize non-novel events. Two fields with ts_backfill. Confidence: 0.57
Core: rp_nip_inverstor divided by its ts_std_dev to prioritize stable impact names. ts_backfill applied. Confidence: 0.72
Core: positive product sentiment plus rising revenue sentiment is stronger; use two fields with ts_backfill. Confidence: 0.64
Core: when nws18_qmb is positive but company business sentiment lags, there may be upside. Two fields backfilled. Confidence: 0.55
Core: if current rp_css_earnings is the argmax in window (ts_arg_max=0) then momentum signal strong. ts_backfill used. Confidence: 0.68
Core: prefer partner signals when rp_ess_partner ts_std_dev is low (stable). Two ops, backfilled. Confidence: 0.60
Core: cross-sectional zscore of rp_css_ratings to pick top-rated moves. ts_backfill applied. Confidence: 0.69
Core: long names where rp_nip_earnings > rp_nip_revenue and short the opposite. Two fields, backfilled and subtract. Confidence: 0.63
Core: apply ts_decay_linear to rp_css_price to favor recent price-news shifts. ts_backfill used. Confidence: 0.66
Core: require both nws18_qmb and rp_ess_earnings to be positive; two fields used and backfilled. Trade_when used. Confidence: 0.61
Core: combine nws18_ghc_lna with rp_css_revenue to find fundamental follow-through. Both backfilled. Confidence: 0.70
Core: rp_css_ptg zscore multiplied by rp_css_price zscore identifies reinforcement. Two fields, backfilled. Confidence: 0.64
Core: use ts_kurtosis to avoid fat-tailed earnings signals; if kurtosis high, shrink signal. ts_backfill used. Confidence: 0.53
Core: prefer rp_css_inverstor when ts_std_dev small. ts_backfill and if_else used. Confidence: 0.65
Core: rp_css_assets + rp_css_price combined to capture asset-level and stock-level pressure. Two fields, backfilled. Confidence: 0.58
Core: ts_ir on rp_nip_mna to find M&A stories with consistent impact. ts_backfill used. Confidence: 0.67
Core: difference between immediate rp_ess_earnings zscore and its ts_mean to detect unexpected moves. ts_backfill applied. Confidence: 0.64
Core: use rp_css_assets to confirm company-level price-news rp_css_price; both backfilled and multiplied. Confidence: 0.59
Core: rp_css_ptg when nws18_qcm high; trade_when gating. Two fields backfilled. Confidence: 0.60
Core: positive rp_css_earnings and rp_css_ratings alignment is stronger; both backfilled. Confidence: 0.71
Core: rp_ess_insider * rp_nip_insider to prioritize impactful insider stories. Two fields backfilled. Confidence: 0.62
Core: extreme short-term rp_css_earnings scores often revert next week; use reverse zscore. ts_backfill applied. Confidence: 0.56
Core: rp_css_price + rp_nip_price where both positive indicates stronger signal. Two fields backfilled. Confidence: 0.64
Core: use ts_product on nws18_ghc_lna to find sustained analyst-change momentum. ts_backfill applied. Confidence: 0.60
Core: scale rp_ess_earnings by rp_nip_earnings to favor impactful novel events. Two fields backfilled. Confidence: 0.69
Core: rp_css_ptg - rp_css_earnings gap highlights mispricing between outlook and fundamentals. Both backfilled. Confidence: 0.63
Core: rp_css_inverstor - rp_css_assets to detect company-specific investor-interest beyond market. Both backfilled. Confidence: 0.66
Core: ts_ir on rp_ess_earnings to find names with stable earnings-event signal. ts_backfill used. Confidence: 0.70
